title: What have been the advantages you got from buying your iPhone directly from Apple? - Quora

response.answer_text: I purchased a completely unlocked iPhone for cash with Apple’s return privileges if I didn’t like it. Additionally, the unlocked version had a better modem chipset (Qualcomm, not Intel) that was better performing on GSM/LTE networks and worked on all networks. I didn’t need to commit to a contract that also locked me to the carrier for 18–24 months with early termination fees. If I travel (even in the US) I want to be able to switch the SIM, if necessary, to a carrier that works in the area I’ll be visiting (without exorbitant charges.) My carrier—AT&T in the US—refused to sell me an unlocked Phone even if i paid cash upfront. Plus the AT&T version of the iPhone used the inferior Intel chipset. Not selling unlocked phones continues to be an AT&T issue. My daughter went to the AT&T store during the CoVID lockdown in April-May 2020 and the iPhone she got was not only locked to AT&T but they would not allow her to pay cash for it. Had to lock herself into a 2 year payment contract.

In the context of Singapore, buying an iPhone directly from Apple will free me from the telcos’ contracts. Most of the telcos in Singapore will tie you down with a contract when you buy an iPhone from them. Another advantage is that I can start to do my pre-order at the time which Apple launches their pre-order. Some telcos can be slow in the pre-order process.
